title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act is titled the "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" and amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a section for the 15th-anniversary review agreement. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010, in connection with the Compact of Free Association, are approved, except for the extension of Article X regarding Federal Programs and Services. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010, in connection with the Compact of Free Association (Public Law 99-658), are approved, excluding the extension of Article X. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 will be provided in fiscal year 2013. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance and fiscal consolidation fund under the Agreement between the United States and Palau will be provided in fiscal years 2012 and 2013, respectively. The United States will provide funding for infrastructure projects under the Agreement in fiscal years 2012 through 2017. Additionally, the fiscal consolidation fund amount for fiscal year 2012 will be reduced by $411,000. In fiscal year 2012, the United States will reduce funding for infrastructure projects by $411,000 under the Agreement. Congress consents to amendments in the Compact subsidiary agreements. Application of related law is specified in the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003. Congress consents to amendments in the Compact subsidiary agreements, authorizing appropriations of $1,500,000 annually for postal services from 2012 to 2024. Additionally, the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 will have the year 2024 substituted for 2009 in a specific section. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 will have the year 2024 substituted for 2009 in a specific section. Authorization of $1,500,000 annually for postal services from 2012 to 2024 is granted for Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 authorizes $1,500,000 annually for postal services from 2012 to 2024 for Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. The Department of the Interior can transfer funds to the United States Postal Service for mail to these countries. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 authorizes appropriations to Federal entities in Palau, Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands through fiscal year 2024 for postal services. The funds shall remain available until expended. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 authorizes appropriations through fiscal year 2024 for various purposes, including commitments of the United States under specific sections of the Compact Review Agreement. These funds shall remain available until expended. The Compact Review Agreement authorizes appropriations for audits and commitments, with oversight by Congress and eligibility for US domestic programs. The Congress finds that the Government of Palau is eligible for certain United States domestic programs, with oversight by the Secretary of the Interior and annual reporting to Congressional committees. The Government of Palau is eligible for US domestic programs overseen by the Secretary of the Interior, requiring annual reports to Congressional committees on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided. The Secretary of the Interior must provide annual reports to Congressional committees on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeal of prior authorization for civil administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and limitation on use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The funds for global health activities for fiscal year 2012 and beyond cannot be used to assist China, with a reduction of $2,000,000 in total amount available. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted. The section restricts funds for global health activities for fiscal year 2012 and beyond by $2,000,000, regardless of other laws enacted. It also includes provisions for climate change funds in the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. SEC. 535. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. Limitation on the use of funds for climate change activities for fiscal years 2012-2024 prohibits assistance to China and reduces total funding by $4,500,000 annually. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted. Additionally, there is a prohibition on funding for Development Innovation Ventures. The section limits funds for climate change activities for fiscal years 2012-2024 by $4,500,000 annually and applies regardless of other laws. There is also a prohibition on funding for the Development Innovation Ventures program. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to restrict funds for the Development Innovation Ventures program at USAID for fiscal years 2012 and 2013. The total amount available for USAID in a fiscal year is reduced by $28,200,000. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 limits funds for the Development Innovation Ventures program at USAID for fiscal years 2012 and 2013. The total amount available for USAID in a fiscal year is reduced by $28,200,000. Amendments are made to Section 542 regarding the use of funds for IMET. Section 542 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to limit funds for assistance to Argentina from fiscal year 2012 through 2024. Limitation on the use of funds for assistance to Argentina from fiscal year 2012 through 2024, with a reduction of $4,500,000 in total obligated amount per fiscal year. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its implementation. The total amount obligated for activities in a fiscal year is reduced by $4,500,000 under this chapter. This subsection applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its implementation. SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. None of the funds for fiscal year 2012 through 2024 for US contributions to the UN can be used for contributions to UNESCO. The total amount for US contributions to the UN is $4,500,000 less than the total amount available for each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. The text states that for fiscal year 2012 and each fiscal year, the total amount available for United States assessed contributions to the United Nations is $4,500,000 less than the total amount made available for such contributions. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. The United States Institute of Peace's funding is limited to $6,811,000 less than the total amount available for fiscal year 2012 and each fiscal year through 2024. This limitation applies despite any other laws enacted after its implementation.
